canonical_explanation.text: 3D shapes have faces (flat surfaces), edges (line segments where faces meet), and vertices (corners where edges meet). Euler's formula states F + V - E = 2 for any convex polyhedron. Views of 3D objects include the front view, side view, and top view. Nets are flat patterns that can be folded into 3D shapes.
rules: Euler's formula: F + V - E = 2 (for convex polyhedra)

questions.question_text: Euler's formula for polyhedra is:
questions.explanation_correct: Euler's formula states F + V - E = 2, where F = faces, V = vertices, E = edges.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct formula is F + V - E = 2.

questions.question_text: A cube has 6 faces and 8 vertices. How many edges does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: Using Euler's formula: F + V - E = 2. 6 + 8 - E = 2. E = 12.

questions.question_text: The top view of a cone is:

options.text: A circle with a point at center

questions.explanation_correct: Looking at a cone from the top, you see a circle (the base) with a point at the center (the apex).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The top view shows the circular base with the apex visible as a point in the center.

questions.question_text: The front view of a cylinder is:
questions.explanation_correct: Looking at a cylinder from the front, you see a rectangle (the height and diameter of the cylinder).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The front/side view of a cylinder appears as a rectangle.

questions.question_text: How many squares are needed to make the net of a cube?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 faces, each a square. Its net consists of 6 squares arranged in a cross or T-shape pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 6 faces = 6 squares in its net.

questions.question_text: A triangular prism has 5 faces and 6 vertices. How many edges does it have?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Euler's formula: 5 + 6 - E = 2. E = 11 - 2 = 9 edges.

questions.question_text: The top view of a sphere is a circle.
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere looks like a circle from any direction, including the top view.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere appears as a circle from all views (top, front, side).

questions.question_text: The net of a cylinder consists of:
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has two circular bases and one curved surface that unfolds into a rectangle. Net: 2 circles + 1 rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The curved surface unrolls into a rectangle. The two bases are circles. So 2 circles + 1 rectangle.

questions.question_text: A tetrahedron has 4 faces, 4 vertices, and ____ edges.
questions.explanation_correct: Using Euler's formula: 4 + 4 - E = 2. E = 6.

questions.question_text: The side view of a cube is:
questions.explanation_correct: The side view (or front view or top view) of a cube is always a square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All views of a cube (front, side, top) appear as squares.

questions.question_text: The net of a cone consists of a circle and a semicircle.
questions.explanation_correct: The net of a cone consists of a circle (base) and a sector (not necessarily a semicircle). It is a semicircle only when the slant height equals the diameter of the base.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The curved surface unrolls into a sector of a circle, which is a semicircle only in special cases.

questions.question_text: A square pyramid has 5 vertices and 8 edges. How many faces does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: F + V - E = 2. F + 5 - 8 = 2. F = 5 faces (1 square base + 4 triangular faces).

questions.question_text: The front view of a triangular prism (with triangular face facing you) is:
questions.explanation_correct: If the triangular face is facing you, the front view is a triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When looking at a triangular prism from the triangular face, you see a triangle.

questions.question_text: Which of the following solids has the same number of faces and vertices?
questions.explanation_correct: Square pyramid: F = 5, V = 5, E = 8. Faces = Vertices = 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cube: F=6, V=8. Tetrahedron: F=4, V=4. Prism: F=5, V=6. Square pyramid: F=5, V=5. Both tetrahedron and square pyramid have F=V, but D is the correct choice listed.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a net of a cube?

options.text: A cross shape (plus sign) of 6 squares

questions.explanation_correct: 6 squares in a straight line cannot fold into a cube (the squares would overlap). There are 11 possible nets of a cube, and a straight line is not one of them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A straight line of 6 squares will cause overlapping when folded. It is not a valid cube net.

questions.question_text: The top view of a cuboid placed on its largest face is a ____.
questions.explanation_correct: Looking at a cuboid from the top when it is resting on its largest face, you see a rectangle (the top face).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The top face of a cuboid is a rectangle, so the top view is a rectangle.

questions.question_text: A cylinder is a polyhedron.
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has curved surfaces, so it is not a polyhedron. Polyhedra have only flat faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Polyhedra are 3D shapes with flat polygonal faces. A cylinder has a curved surface, so it is not a polyhedron.

questions.question_text: The net of a triangular prism contains:
questions.explanation_correct: A triangular prism has 2 triangular faces and 3 rectangular faces. Its net has 3 rectangles and 2 triangles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Triangular prism: 2 triangular bases + 3 rectangular lateral faces.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has the front view as a triangle and the top view as a circle?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has a triangular front/side view and a circular top view.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Front view = triangle, top view = circle. This describes a cone.

questions.question_text: A pentagonal prism has how many faces?
questions.explanation_correct: A pentagonal prism has 2 pentagonal bases + 5 rectangular lateral faces = 7 faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pentagonal prism: 2 pentagonal faces + 5 rectangular faces = 7 faces total.

questions.question_text: A polyhedron has 10 edges and 6 vertices. How many faces does it have?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Euler's formula: F = 2 - V + E = 2 - 6 + 10 = 6.

questions.question_text: A solid has the same front view, side view, and top view, all being circles. What is the solid?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere looks like a circle from every direction (front, side, and top).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only a sphere has circular appearance from all directions. A cylinder has a rectangle from the side.

questions.question_text: A cube of side 4 cm is cut in half horizontally. What shape is the cross-section?
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting a cube horizontally (parallel to the base) produces a square cross-section with side 4 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A horizontal cross-section of a cube is a square (same dimensions as the face).

questions.question_text: A hexagonal prism has 8 faces. How many vertices does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: Hexagonal prism: F = 8, E = 18 (6 top + 6 bottom + 6 lateral). V = 2 + E - F = 2 + 18 - 8 = 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hexagonal prism has 2 hexagonal faces + 6 rectangular faces. V = 2 x 6 = 12. E = 3 x 6 = 18. Check: 8 + 12 - 18 = 2.

questions.question_text: The front view of a hemisphere placed with its flat face on the ground is a ____.
questions.explanation_correct: Looking at a hemisphere from the front (with flat face down), you see a semicircle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The front view of a hemisphere resting on its flat face shows a semicircular shape.

questions.question_text: If a cylinder is cut vertically (along its axis), the cross-section is:
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting a cylinder vertically through the axis gives a rectangular cross-section (height x diameter).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A vertical cut through the axis of a cylinder produces a rectangle with height = cylinder height and width = diameter.

questions.question_text: Verify Euler's formula for a cuboid.
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has 6 faces, 8 vertices, and 12 edges. F + V - E = 6 + 8 - 12 = 2. Verified.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cuboid: 6 faces (3 pairs of rectangles), 8 vertices, 12 edges. 6+8-12=2.

questions.question_text: A 3D object has a rectangular front view and a circular top view. What could it be?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has a rectangular front/side view and a circular top view.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Front = rectangle, top = circle. A cylinder fits both views.

questions.question_text: A cross-section of a cube can be a triangle.
questions.explanation_correct: If you cut a cube diagonally through three edges meeting at a vertex, the cross-section is a triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cutting a cube with a plane through three edges meeting at one vertex creates a triangular cross-section.

questions.question_text: An octahedron has 8 triangular faces and 6 vertices. How many edges does it have?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Euler: 8 + 6 - E = 2. E = 12 edges.

questions.question_text: Which solid has a square top view and a triangular front view?
questions.explanation_correct: A square pyramid has a square base (top view shows a square with diagonals/point) and a triangular front view.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Top = square (the base), front = triangle (the slant face). This is a square pyramid.

questions.question_text: The net of a square pyramid consists of:
questions.explanation_correct: A square pyramid has 1 square base and 4 triangular lateral faces. Its net has 1 square + 4 triangles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Square pyramid: 1 square base + 4 triangular faces = 5 faces total.

questions.question_text: A pentagonal pyramid has 6 faces, 6 vertices, and ____ edges.
Two cubes are placed side by side. The front view of the combined shape is:

options.text: A rectangle with length twice the side

questions.explanation_correct: Two cubes side by side form a cuboid. The front view is a rectangle with length = 2 x side and height = side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Side by side cubes look like a rectangle (2a x a) from the front.

questions.question_text: Every arrangement of 6 squares forms a valid net of a cube.
questions.explanation_correct: Not every arrangement of 6 squares forms a valid net. There are exactly 11 distinct nets of a cube out of many possible arrangements.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only 11 out of 35 possible hexomino arrangements are valid cube nets. Most arrangements will not fold into a cube.

questions.question_text: A solid has 7 faces, 10 vertices, and 15 edges. Does it satisfy Euler's formula?

options.text: No, 7 + 10 - 15 = 2, but it is not a polyhedron
Yes, and it must be a pentagonal prism

questions.explanation_correct: F + V - E = 7 + 10 - 15 = 2. Yes, it satisfies Euler's formula.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 7 + 10 - 15 = 2. Euler's formula is satisfied.

questions.question_text: What is the top view of a cone placed with its apex pointing upward?

options.text: A circle with a dot in the centre

questions.explanation_correct: From the top, you see the circular base with the apex appearing as a central point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Top view of a cone: circular base + apex point at centre.

questions.question_text: A cross-section of a cylinder cut parallel to its base is:
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting a cylinder parallel to its base gives a circular cross-section with the same radius as the base.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A horizontal cut (parallel to base) through a cylinder produces a circle.

questions.question_text: A polyhedron has 20 triangular faces. Using Euler's formula, if it has 12 vertices, how many edges does it have?
questions.explanation_incorrect: 20 + 12 - E = 2. E = 30 edges. (This is an icosahedron.)

questions.question_text: What is the cross-section of a cube cut by a plane passing through the midpoints of three edges meeting at one vertex?
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting through the midpoints of three edges meeting at one vertex of a cube creates an equilateral triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The three midpoints are equidistant from each other (each at half of face diagonal), forming an equilateral triangle.

questions.question_text: A solid has front view = rectangle, side view = rectangle, top view = rectangle. It could be:

options.text: Either a cuboid or a cube

questions.explanation_correct: A cube shows squares (special rectangles) from all views. A cuboid shows rectangles. Both have rectangular views from all three directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both cubes and cuboids show rectangles (squares are rectangles) from all views.

questions.question_text: If a polyhedron has all triangular faces and 6 vertices, what are the number of faces and edges?
questions.explanation_correct: Each face is a triangle (3 edges). Each edge is shared by 2 faces. So 3F = 2E, giving E = 3F/2. Euler: F + 6 - 3F/2 = 2. 2F + 12 - 3F = 4. F = 8. E = 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3F = 2E (counting edges from faces). F + 6 - E = 2. Solving: F = 8, E = 12.

questions.question_text: The cross-section of a cylinder cut at an angle (neither parallel nor perpendicular to the base) is a(n) ____.
questions.explanation_correct: An oblique cut through a cylinder produces an elliptical cross-section.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A slanted cut through a cylinder creates an ellipse.

questions.question_text: A solid has 12 faces, 20 vertices, and 30 edges. Does it satisfy Euler's formula? What solid is it?
questions.explanation_correct: 12 + 20 - 30 = 2. Euler's formula is satisfied. A solid with 12 pentagonal faces is a dodecahedron.
questions.explanation_incorrect: F + V - E = 12 + 20 - 30 = 2. This is a dodecahedron (12 pentagonal faces).

questions.question_text: A cone is placed on top of a cylinder (same radius). What is the front view of this combined solid?

options.text: A triangle on top of a rectangle
A rectangle with a triangle on top
Both A and B (they describe the same thing)

questions.explanation_correct: The front view shows a rectangle (cylinder) with a triangle (cone) on top. Options A and B describe the same shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Front view: rectangle (cylinder) + triangle (cone) on top. A and B say the same thing.

questions.question_text: For a prism with an n-sided base, the number of edges is 3n.
questions.explanation_correct: A prism with n-sided base has: n top edges + n bottom edges + n lateral edges = 3n edges.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Prism with n-gon base: n edges on top + n on bottom + n connecting = 3n edges.

questions.question_text: How many faces of a cube are visible in a single 2D view (from any one direction)?
questions.explanation_correct: From any single direction (front, top, or side), only 1 face of a cube is visible as the view is a flat projection showing one face.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A standard orthographic view (front, side, or top) shows exactly one face of a cube.

questions.question_text: A solid has 8 faces (all equilateral triangles). What are V and E?
questions.explanation_correct: 8 triangular faces: 3F = 2E gives E = 12. Euler: 8 + V - 12 = 2, V = 6. This is an octahedron.
questions.explanation_incorrect: E = 3x8/2 = 12. V = 2 - 8 + 12 = 6. This is a regular octahedron.

questions.question_text: Which of these shapes has different front view and side view?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid with different length, breadth, and height has different-sized rectangular front and side views.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sphere: all views are circles. Cube: all views are squares. Cone: front and side are both triangles. Cuboid with unequal dimensions has different rectangular views.

questions.question_text: A cube of side 6 cm is cut by a plane passing through the midpoints of all 6 edges connected to two opposite vertices. What is the shape of the cross-section?
questions.explanation_correct: Cutting through the midpoints of all edges around the middle of a cube (6 edges connecting top and bottom via sides) creates a regular hexagon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This classic cross-section produces a regular hexagon where each side equals 3 sqrt(2) cm.
